title: Increasing LP each win.
body:
Okay, so I'm kind of new to the ranked scene but after I completed my provisionals which was last weekend I was put into Bronze 2. ( ;_; ) 
Anyway, after my provisionals I've been playing a few games of ranked and my 1st win I recieved 21 LP. The second time I won I recieved 25 LP and the third time I won I have just recieved 28 LP. What's with the increasing LP? I thought that 25 LP was alot to get from a win because from 0 LP, after 4 wins you'll get to your promos. That seems really fast. 
Just wondering what's with my increasing LP gain.

Cheers
-Cardew

replies.body:
First you need to understand what elo is. Elo is basically a number rating of your skill, the more games you win the higher it gets. And if you win against a team with more elo than you, then you'll gain a lot in return (since you were supposed to loose). This also works vice versa.

Bronze 2 consists of players with on average 1150 elo. You must be playing at higher elo than this, say at 1250 elo. Since you're essentially playing at a harder difficulty, you should be rewarded with more LP.

It'll also help you climb faster to get to where you really belong.

your mmr increases when you win.
the higher your mmr, the more LP you gain.

Yeah but I was placed in Bronze 2. I don't fully understand I guess... 
28 LP for 1 win seems high.

LP gains and losses are still particularly volatile just after placement games as the system continues to hone in your level of skill. So yes 25-30LP a game is high but it's the systems way of moving you towards the ranking your skill deserves.
You can, it is possible, to do so well that you skip ranks, say going from Silver 4 to Silver 1.
I was receiving 35 LP per win once, playing at Silver 3 against Gold 4. I've dropped since then, but I imagine you can get much higher than that even, if you decay from Challenger or something.
why are you complaining? be grateful
